summary: A personal 'sorry' website featuring a heartfelt sorry letter and an interactive forgiveness page with playful 'Yes/No' buttons. Clicking 'Yes' reveals a special 'I love you' memory card and an ILY letter. The memories section has been removed.

existing_features.title: Create a warm, romantic, and emotionally tender visual theme for the entire website â€” soft warm tones (creams, blush pinks, dusty roses), elegant serif typography for headings, gentle animations (subtle fade-ins, floating hearts), and a flowing, intimate layout that feels personal and sincere. Apply this theme consistently across all pages and sections.

Build a hero/landing section at the top of the website with a large heartfelt title (e.g., 'I'm Sorry'), a short emotional subtitle, and a soft animated background (floating petals or subtle gradient pulse). Include a gentle scroll-down indicator.

Create a 'Our Memories' section that displays a curated gallery/timeline of shared memories between the two people. Each memory card should include a placeholder image slot (rendered from generated assets), a short caption/description, and an optional date. The memories should be presented in a visually appealing grid or timeline layout.

Create a 'My Sorry Letter' section that displays a full, heartfelt, well-written sorry letter styled as a handwritten-looking letter (decorative letter paper background, handwriting-style or elegant script font for the letter body). The letter should acknowledge mistakes, express genuine remorse, and ask for forgiveness.
Add a closing footer section with a final short message of love and hope (e.g., 'With all my love and hope for a second chance â™¥'), styled consistently with the overall romantic theme.
Render the generated static image assets (letter paper background, memory card placeholders, decorative hero background) from frontend/public/assets/generated throughout the website.

In the MemoriesSection component, update the first memory card: (1) replace its placeholder image with the uploaded photo saved as 'frontend/public/assets/generated/memory-first-trip.jpg', and (2) change the card's caption/title from 'Our First Walk Together' to 'Our First Trip Together'.

Investigate and resolve any broken image path, incorrect src attribute, missing public asset reference, or Vite static asset configuration issue preventing the image from displaying. The image should be served as a static asset from the public directory and visible in the browser without any broken-image icon.

Fix the first memory card image in MemoriesSection so that the photo at '/assets/generated/memory-first-trip.jpg' renders visibly in the browser. Use a hardcoded absolute public path (e.g., '/assets/generated/memory-first-trip.jpg') as the img src. Add an onError handler to log failures. Ensure the image element has explicit width and height styles so it is not collapsed when loading.

Update MemoriesSection to display exactly three memory cards: (1) 'Our First Trip Together' with the uploaded photo at '/assets/generated/memory-first-trip.jpg', (2) a second romantic memory card with a placeholder image and an appropriate caption, and (3) a third romantic memory card with a placeholder image and an appropriate caption.
